clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized, Controlled Trial of Inspiratory Muscle Training (IMT)in the ICU and CCU
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Controlled Trial of Inspiratory Muscle Training (IMT)in the ICU and CCU

brief_summary.textblock: Inspiratory muscle training (IMT) is an intervention used with success in the outpatient setting within the COPD population. Use of IMT is also theoretically possible during mechanical ventilation. This study will determine if the IMT excercise will increase Maximum Inspiratory Pressure and will also assess the feseability and safety of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Maximum Inspiratory Pressure at baseline and before extubation.

other_outcome.measure: Time to extubation after start of IMT

arm_group.description: In the IMT group, inspiratory muscle training will start with 30% of MIP, for five minutes twice a day with increments of 10 % (absolute) everyday. Supplemental oxygen will be given as needed. The exercise will be done seven days a week until patient achieves liberation from mechanical ventilation or ICU/CCU discharge.
In the SHAM group, sham device will be used to train subjects 5 minutes twice a day, seven days a week until patient achieves liberation from mechanical ventilation or ICU/CCU discharge.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mechanically ventilated patients.
- Must have passed spontaneuos brething trial screening but failed the trial itself.
- Potential subject must be able to perform atleast 5 minutes of spontaneous breathing trial.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known neuromuscular disease
- Unstable cardiac ischemia
- Tracheostomized patients
